results.title: Alexander and the car with a missing headlight
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Freitag, Peter Fleischmann, Institut für Film und Bild and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Released by the Weston Woods Studios in 1966 and English language version directed by Cynthia Freitag. A fantasy about a small boy’s adventures as he drives around the world in an old car. Pictures, sound effects and narrative comments are by children of different nations. From the book by Peter Fleischmann and Morton Schindel. Suitable for lower primary level.

results.title: Fourteen rats and a ratcatcher
results.creator_credit: Francesco Tenze, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: There is inevitable conflict between an old woman and a family of rats living under the same roof. A deal is struck when the old woman brings in a ratcatcher. Based on the book by James Cressy and Jamasin Cole.

results.title: The Snowman
results.creator_credit: Dianne Jackson, John Coates and Snowman Enterprises
results.brief_description: A young boy dreams that his snowman comes to life. Together they share the perils and joys of winter. This animated film uses muted pastels coupled with an exquisite orchestral score to make this non-verbal Christmas tale an experience for all seasons. Based on the book by Raymond Briggs.

results.title: The Brotherhood of St Laurence
results.creator_credit: Brotherhood of St Lawrence Production Co
results.brief_description: The Brotherhood, which is based in Melbourne, works for a better deal for disadvantaged people. This documentary describes the Brotherhood’s beginnings; its current welfare services, including accommodation for older people, a material aid service, and a sheltered workshop; its support for other independent groups; and its involvement in social issues.

results.title: Acceptable Levels
results.brief_description: John Davies’ incisive drama on the responsibility of the media to those they film and photograph and the abuse of that responsibility in the pursuit of “acceptable” news and entertainment. A drama set in Northern Ireland.

results.title: The Secret country: the first Australians fight back
results.creator_credit: Alan Lowery and Central Independent Television (UK)
results.brief_description: According to John Pilger, “Australia is a secret country with a secret history.” This documentary looks at that history, the history of Australian First Nations peoples from the time of white settlement to the present, and reveals the extent of the cruelty and injustice inflicted upon them. The central issue throughout the film is the differing perspectives on the land and its uses, providing historical background to the present land rights movement and other areas of activism.

results.title: Family Therapy(TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Francis Sealey, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Looks at the way problems of individuals are often caused and maintained by their role in the family, Shows examples of some families in counselling sessions and the techniques used by therapists to help the family as a whole

results.title: Speaking from Experience
results.brief_description: The aim of this 2-part program is to strongly promote the importance of the involvement in the mental health services of people who either are using or have used these services. Part 1 covers: “Introduction and United Kingdom Projects”. Part 2 covers: “User involvement in Holland and Conclusion”.

results.title: To live until you die
results.creator_credit: Eric Davidson, Andrew Maclear, Time-Life Films and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: A documentary about Elisabeth Kubler-Ross and her work. Doctor Kubler-Ross is a trained medical practitioner and psychiatrist and has specialised in the care of dying patients - both young and old. Her work concentrates on the re-education of people’s attitudes towards dying, and a great deal of her time is spent, not only with patients, but also lecturing to others.
